text: Meet Aika, who I got 3 weeks ago and have been in love with ever since! You can follow Aika’s adventures here: http://instagram.com/aika_theminiaussie/ …  #NationalPuppyDay
author: dorianwarren

text: Thank you for listening and sharing!
author: dorianwarren

text: My latest piece is a reflection on last week's #BoldvOld conference, which showcased the the big & bold ideas/solutions that are based on the real experiences of everyday people. These ideas are transforming our politics in DC & across the country.
author: dorianwarren

text: It was great to be on #WITHpod with @chrislhayes to talk about how we can build power from the ground up and create a progressive majority. Take a listen below!
author: dorianwarren

text: Thanks for listening and sharing!
author: dorianwarren

text: My heart weeps today for the victims of the #ChristchurchAttack. There is no room anywhere for the hate that drives white supremacy and Islamophobia. We owe it to each other to eradicate this poison. Love trumps hate is not just a slogan; it reminds us of our shared humanity.
author: dorianwarren

text: I’ve said it before and will say it again: @staceyabrams represents the very best of both the Democratic Party’s present & future. Loved hearing her talk with my brother @rashadrobinson at #BoldvOld about voting rights and bold economic messaging across the country. #BeBold
author: dorianwarren

text: Great to be at #BoldvOld with @SenKamalaHarris, @SenBooker and @FeliciaWongRI! It’s time for us to #BeBold and rewrite the rules of the economy and democracy together so working families across America can thrive.
author: dorianwarren

text:
Excited to join @EconomicSecProj, @Hewlett_Found,
@rooseveltinst, @chrishughes, @nataliefoster, @FeliciaWongRI, & many others for #BoldvOld, where we'll spend the day discussing how we can #BeBold in reforming our economy & democracy! Follow @communitychange for live updates.
author: dorianwarren

text: This is fantastic news for democracy and the American public. Republicans have told (and continue to tell) a lot of lies about #HR1, but know this: It’s time for our government to work #ForThePeople, and this bill helps ensure that it does.
author: dorianwarren

text: Wait, what?? Ok @nytdavidbrooks!: The Case for Reparations
author: dorianwarren

text: @JillWineBanks is wearing an amazing brooch tonight on @TheLastWord with @Lawrence. It looks like a teapot...hmmm. #TeaPotDome https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Teapot_Dome_scandal …
author: dorianwarren

text: Must-read article about a *must-read* new book by the brilliant @JonathanMetzl: Trump Is a Health Hazard to His Supporters  https://tonic.vice.com/en_us/article/a3bad8/how-trump-supporters-are-dangers-to-themselves?utm_campaign=sharebutton … via @dailytonic
author: dorianwarren

text: This is huge news. Congrats @MaketheRoadNY and thank you for your work on this! People power prevailed over #BackersofHate -- there's no overstating the importance of organizing
author: dorianwarren

text: The insistence on silencing Muslim women of color while white men in Congress routinely engage in anti-Semitic & white supremacist tropes is telling. Targeting people who are critical of Israel makes a mockery out of democracy. Dems everywhere should be ashamed. #IStandWithIlhan
author: dorianwarren

text: cc @MarkMeadows...
author: dorianwarren

text: News flash: Having Black friends or nieces & nephews who are people of color doesn’t make you any less racist. It just makes you a racist who knows Black people and other people of color.
author: dorianwarren

text: Must-read by @CFPetrella: Perspective | The ominous history surrounding President Trump’s Fourth of July rally
author: dorianwarren

text: .@NYGovCuomo says he doesn’t know @MaketheRoadNY... how do you explain this video then? MRNY is a powerful organization that gets results. Dismiss them and their power to your own detriment. New York is stronger because of their work and I’m proud to support them. #IAmMaketheRoad
author: dorianwarren

text: .@JonathanMetzl's latest book, Dying of Whiteness, makes a vital contribution to the nat'l conversation about racism & its discontents. A must-read if you want to understand how race & the color line operate in 21st century America. You can preorder here:
author: dorianwarren

text: Today’s "revelation" about Trump’s animosity towards black folks tells us one thing: there are still people in this country who are not paying attention.
author: dorianwarren

text: Are we really surprised that a man willing to shut down America for a white-nationalist-approved immigration agenda has said racist things? Does his long history of cheating communities of color not speak for itself?
author: dorianwarren

text: McConnell is one of the most destructive figures in American politics. He has surrendered the Senate to the president, taken a Louisville slugger to democracy & continuously suppresses the will of the people. He embodies everything that's wrong w/politics.
author: dorianwarren

text: Um...well #46 apparently could declare a #nationalemergency on #inequality and #climatechange with the @GOP saying it’s all good.
author: dorianwarren

text: Yep. #BreakingNews: We’ve been living in the 2nd Gilded Age for about 30 years now.
author: dorianwarren

text: When elections have consequences for justice—Breaking: Whitmer halts land sale for $35M private immigrant detention center ⋆ Michigan Advance
author: dorianwarren

text: Don’t mince words about what’s happening. The GOP is full of feckless leaders, including Mitch McConnell, who are running this country into the ground for power and control, and it’s dangerous. Let today serve as a reminder of why we need to fight like hell for democracy.
author: dorianwarren

text:
Climate change is a national emergency.
Gun violence is a national emergency.
Poverty is a national emergency.

What’s happening at the border is not a national emergency, but it is Trump’s excuse to engage in demagoguery & authoritarianism. We are in very dangerous territory.
author: dorianwarren

text: Thank you @stephanievalenc for elevating the convo with spot-on observations and questions.
author: dorianwarren

text: Trump has made it his mission to tear families apart, support only the interests of the wealthy few and demonize our communities. Heading into the #SOTU, we know that most voters are done with Trump and are ready to turn the page. He’s a disgrace no matter what he says tonight.
author: dorianwarren

text: Whether it’s 1964, 1984 or 2019, what @RalphNortham did is unacceptable. Whether you’re a Republican or Democrat, the message should be clear: White supremacy won’t be tolerated in any way, especially not on the first day of #BlackHistoryMonth. Northam should resign immediately.
author: dorianwarren

text: So proud of and happy for @stepville--book is #3 on NYT Best Sellers list!: ‘Maid’ Offers a Striking Portrait of Single-Working-Motherhood via @thenation
author: dorianwarren

text: This was a smart move. @staceyabrams represents both the best of the Democratic Party today and the future of the Democratic Party tomorrow. No doubt that her #SOTU response will reflect her brilliance and political talent.
author: dorianwarren

text: This is absolutely heartbreaking. Safety should be a non-negotiable right. Racism & homophobia are alive and well, and we need to keep fighting for a world in which no one is the target of this bigoted violence. Wishing @JussieSmollett a speedy recovery.
author: dorianwarren

text: My new favorite podcast from @stephanievalenc and @Kyle_Lierman. Check it out!
author: dorianwarren

text: Trump is fighting a battle he won’t win. Democrats need to continue holding the line and not cave in to this administration’s racist demands. Trump won’t hold federal workers and families across the country hostage and get away with it. #TrumpShutdown
author: dorianwarren

text: Great profile by @joanwalsh on @RepJayapal: How Pramila Jayapal’s Inside-Outside Strategy Is Changing the Future of Progressive Politics via @thenation
author: dorianwarren

text: Tune in tomorrow for @WK_Kellogg_Fdn's livestream on Facebook as we celebrate the National Day of Racial Healing: http://wkkf.co/ndorh  #HowWeHeal #MLK #MLKDay
author: dorianwarren

text: We remember him as a hero, but the time of his assassination, Dr. King was unpopular with the public for his radical campaign to end poverty. Along w/ 12 other nonprofit leaders, I spoke with @Philanthropy about his legacy: http://bit.ly/2RUHeNG  #MLKDay #MLK90 #EndPoverty #MLK
author: dorianwarren

text: Caving to the GOP’s ridiculous, hateful demands shows them that this tactic—shutting down the government when they don’t get their way—is one that can (& will) be used each & every time they want to impose their will on us. Remember: a majority of the public opposes the wall. 3/3
author: dorianwarren

text: The important thing here is that Dems continue to stand up to the white nationalist-run GOP and let them know that there is no world in which Rs get what they want by using families as bargaining chips for a racist border wall. 2/3
author: dorianwarren

text: Ahead of Trump’s announcement later today, we should have absolute clarity about this moment: Never negotiate with or cave to white supremacists. Period. Trump is negotiating in bad faith & holding families hostage. Dems need to hold the line. #Not1Dollar #TrumpShutdown 1/3
author: dorianwarren

text: Grateful for @annagalland and @iSheyman's leadership at @MoveOn for the past few years. The progressive movement is stronger because of them. Excited to see what you both do next and looking forward to working with the next executive director!
author: dorianwarren

text:
It's been nearly 10 years since Congress last raised the minimum wage. House and Senate Democrats just introduced a bill to raise the minimum wage to $15 an hour. It's time to win the #FightFor15. 

Add your support: http://FightFor15.org  #RaiseTheWage
author: dorianwarren

text: We should call a spade a spade and it really should not be this hard. Resistance to naming things and people what they are—in this case racist and white supremacist—not only keeps the status quo intact, but provides cover and legitimacy for what is clearly unacceptable.
author: dorianwarren

text: America Needs Economic Rights. Now Is the Time to Push for Them. via @thenation
author: dorianwarren

text: William Barr should not be the next Attorney General. He was a proponent of expanding the prison system, has defended Trump's xenophobic positions, attacked reproductive freedom and has an anti-LGBTQ record. All of our civil rights are at stake. #SaveJustice
author: dorianwarren

text: Amen!
author: dorianwarren

text: Trying to "rein in" progressives like @AOC who speak fluently about our communities' issues and understand the urgency of the current political moment seems like a self-defeating exercise for the country overall and the Democratic Party in particular.
author: dorianwarren

text: He's been leading this propaganda/misinformation campaign about what he alleges is going on at the border and any coverage of this speech without fact checking/factual follow up will be a disservice to the entire country and our communities.
author: dorianwarren

text: Trump is going to get on TV tonight and lie like he always does. There are no two ways about it. This #immigration speech he's going to give from the Oval Office will be about the "crisis" at the border that he manufactured and is now exploiting. It's sickening.
author: dorianwarren

text: Lol—but only if he worked regularly when it’s open. #LazyPotus
author: dorianwarren

text: From the brilliant @Dr_CMGreer: 2018 Election Reflection Series: It’s Time for Political Scientists to Come Off of the Sidelines - http://bit.ly/2SZ9knE
author: dorianwarren

text: Call your senator and tell them #Not1Dollar should go to funding Trump’s deportation machine
author: dorianwarren

text: Republicans are terrible at governing. They are uninterested in actually running the country, but rather want to exercise raw power over the rest of us. They control the *entire* federal govt & can’t even fund it. What an embarrassing shame. #trumpshutdown #governmentshutdown
author: dorianwarren

text: This video should be played on a loop today. Trump’s trying to point fingers now, meanwhile last week he was signing a completely different tune. He said he’s “proud” to own the shutdown. None of us should forget that. #TrumpShutdown #GovernmentShutdown
author: dorianwarren

text: Congrats! Can’t wait.
author: dorianwarren

text: @joelowndes
author: dorianwarren

text: Meanwhile, McSally’s consolation prize for losing her Senate race is... an appointment to the Senate.
author: dorianwarren

text: Yup. It’s the McBath seat now. They better put some respect on her name!
author: dorianwarren

text: Yep. You’d think, but...
author: dorianwarren

text: Exactly, even though all three of those candidates ran high-profile campaigns with a lot of attention. Abrams was the most Googled politician of the year and ran a visionary campaign. Gillum lost by less than 1% in a battleground state. But only Beto should be president?
author: dorianwarren

text: As we look to 2020, I want us to be crystal clear on who we are elevating to what status and why. Our communities will show up to demand political representation AND substantive policies to back it up. As @AyannaPressley says, change can’t wait. Our time is now.
author: dorianwarren

text: I don’t know Beto and I would’ve been as happy as the next person if he beat Ted Cruz, but the way we talk about (or don’t, for that matter) certain candidates is more of an indictment of the country’s politics as a whole than any one person’s in particular.
author: dorianwarren

text: It will never not be astonishing how white men with ambiguous politics who lose their races seemingly automatically become contenders for higher office, meanwhile candidates of color (see: Abrams, Gillum) aren’t afforded this same push for a promotion.
author: dorianwarren

text: The first formal press briefing since November 27... Almost a whole *month* ago. This White House is trying to stop the public from holding it accountable by having so few press briefings compared with previous administrations. It’s outrageous.
author: dorianwarren

text: The threat of a #TrumpShutdown over the border wall is more than just a tantrum; it's a political stunt that risks thousands of lives and Dems need to hold the line. #Not1Dollar for his hateful agenda. My latest with @KicaMatos for @thehill:
author: dorianwarren

text: We’re already in S2E12
author: dorianwarren

text: Is it 1958 or 2018?
author: dorianwarren

text: Imagine being Marco Rubio and voting for massive tax cuts that enabled corporate stock buybacks in the face of stagnant wages for workers, then complaining about those very same stock buybacks a year later. You can’t have your cake and eat it too, senator.
author: dorianwarren

text: Awww, thanks @stepville! I’m SO excited for your book to drop next month. Can’t wait for the world to hear your story and storytelling! Pre-order here: https://www.amazon.com/Maid-Hard-Work-Mothers-Survive/dp/0316505110 …
author: dorianwarren

text: It was great meeting and being in conversation with you today!
author: dorianwarren

text: This is awful. Amazon decided that it wants to profit off of the families that are being destroyed by the government's deportation machine. Whenever a company's bottom line is more important than the lives at stake, that should raise major red flags.
author: dorianwarren

text: Yeah, probably not...
author: dorianwarren

text: What a fun party with this RockStar squad!
author: dorianwarren

text: At times like this, I'm reminded of @Ocasio2018's call for moral clarity. We have to ground our moral center in the values and needs of our communities, and Trump's racist border wall flies in the face of what's right. It's time to #DefundHate. #Not1Dollar for Trump's wall.
author: dorianwarren

text: Today's the last day to submit a comment opposing the Trump admin's proposed "#publiccharge" rule (http://bit.ly/submitcomment ), which targets immigrants & will harm families. Read my piece with @dreaflynn from October about the proposal: http://cnn.it/2CucMSn  #protectfamilies
author: dorianwarren

text: Can $1k a month for a year– no strings attached– end poverty? https://www.msnbc.com/ali-velshi/watch/can-1k-a-month-for-a-year-no-strings-attached-end-poverty-1390776387517 … via @msnbc
author: dorianwarren

text: This is what an antiracist America would look like. How do we get there? https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/dec/06/antiracism-and-america-white-nationalism?CMP=share_btn_tw … Great work by @DrIbram @CFPetrella @AntiracismCtr @GuardianUS
author: dorianwarren

text: DC folks, show up tomorrow if you can and speak out to #DefundHate
author: dorianwarren

text: My latest post-mortem on the 2018 Election: Removing obstacles to voting needs to be a national priority
author: dorianwarren

text: ICYMI: A federal judge will heard the case of Trump's 2020 citizenship census question this week. We must hold Trump accountable for this attempt to degrade another American democratic institution and demand that every voice be counted. https://nyti.ms/2DMNvU6  #SaveTheCensus
author: dorianwarren

text: The #2018FarmBill should strengthen #SNAP to make it easier for families nationwide to put food on the table. Efforts to cut SNAP by implementing work requirements would take food away from those families and their children.
author: dorianwarren

text: Millions of people, including college students, rely on SNAP to live and thrive. Our @communitychange fellow, Ayanna Albertson, recently wrote about how access to SNAP helped her graduate from college.
author: dorianwarren

text: "Today, my daughter is thriving. She has a good job, a boyfriend, she even got herself a dog recently. She is sober. She is happy. She is alive." From our @communitychange Safety Net Fellow @winter_girls_ak in @lennyletter:
author: dorianwarren

text: Race and poverty are inextricably linked. It should go without saying that no one deserves to be poor, but everyone deserves affordable, quality housing.
author: dorianwarren

text: We cannot turn our backs on refugee families. We will continue to demand #RefugeForFamilies. Join the Cross-Border Humanitarian and Legal Response here http://bit.ly/2Dhrf5h
author: dorianwarren

text: America is stronger when everyone has access to the support they need. The changes to the #PublicCharge regulation support Trump’s racist agenda and would threaten the livelihoods of immigrant families. Take a stand, submit a comment, and #ProtectFamilies:
author: dorianwarren

text: .@JGOODHEART1 of @capitalandmain and I discussed building grassroots power to usher in a progressive governing majority and what we can expect from a Democratic House.
author: dorianwarren

text: Our @communitychange fellow Bobbi Dempsey wrote a piece for our column, Voices of Everyday Leaders, to highlight the Philadelphia Unemployment Project's efforts to save #SNAP benefits. http://bit.ly/2JuTjT7
author: dorianwarren

text: A hunger strike has been staged by women in the caravan awaiting asylum. After the perilous journey to the border, they are protesting to put pressure on the US government to ensure #RefugeForFamilies.
author: dorianwarren

text: Food for thought this weekend: #Dreamer, #DACA advocate, and author @julissaarce reflects on what has changed since the Civil Rights Movement, what remains unchanged, and what has shifted under the Trump Administration.
author: dorianwarren

text: Read this piece from our @communitychange fellow @stepville about domestic violence and her struggle for survival soon after getting married:
author: dorianwarren

text: 2,300 kids separated from their families are still living in tent cities. Family and community members are asking for answers about the conditions inside but are not receiving answers. We MUST come together and demand transparency.
author: dorianwarren

text: There's an urgent need to address our current climate crisis that is worsening by the day and disproportionately harms communities of color.
author: dorianwarren

text: America is stronger when everyone has access to the support they need. The changes to the #PublicCharge regulation support Trump’s racist agenda and would threaten the livelihoods of immigrant families. Take a stand, submit a comment, and #ProtectFamilies: http://bit.ly/submitcomment
author: dorianwarren

text: ICYMI: One way to tackle wealth inequality is to give poor children money early on that will increase in value over time, as @SenBooker proposes to do in his new bill. Read more about the proposal in @voxdotcom:
author: dorianwarren

text: Las familias de refugiados han hecho el peligroso viaje atravesando países en busca de un futuro mejor en los Estados Unidos. Debemos exigir que nuestros líderes electos mantengan nuestros valores y aseguren refugio para las familias. #RefugeForFamilies
author: dorianwarren

text: From our partners at @Re4mImmigration. Take action. #RefugeForFamilies
author: dorianwarren
